name: bulbasaur
behavior: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

name: ivysaur
behavior: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

name: venusaur
behavior: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.

name: charmander
behavior: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

name: charmeleon
behavior: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

name: charizard
behavior: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

name: squirtle
behavior: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

name: wartortle
behavior: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

name: blastoise
behavior: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

name: caterpie
behavior: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: metapod
behavior: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.

name: butterfree
behavior: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

name: weedle
behavior: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

name: kakuna
behavior: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

name: beedrill
behavior: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

name: pidgey
behavior: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

name: pidgeotto
behavior: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

name: pidgeot
behavior: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

name: rattata
behavior: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

name: raticate
behavior: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

name: spearow
behavior: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

name: fearow
behavior: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

name: ekans
behavior: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: arbok
behavior: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

name: pikachu
behavior: When Pikachu meet, they’ll touch their tails together and exchange electricity through them as a form of greeting.

name: raichu
behavior: If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.

name: sandshrew
behavior: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

name: sandslash
behavior: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

name: nidoran-f
behavior: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.

name: nidorina
behavior: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

name: nidoqueen
behavior: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

name: nidoran-m
behavior: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.

name: nidorino
behavior: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

name: nidoking
behavior: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

name: clefairy
behavior: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

name: clefable
behavior: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they’re usually found in quiet places.

name: vulpix
behavior: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

name: ninetales
behavior: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

name: jigglypuff
behavior: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.

name: wigglytuff
behavior: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.

name: zubat
behavior: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light won’t reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

name: golbat
behavior: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

name: oddish
behavior: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

name: gloom
behavior: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

name: vileplume
behavior: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

name: paras
behavior: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

name: parasect
behavior: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

name: venonat
behavior: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

name: venomoth
behavior: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

name: diglett
behavior: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

name: dugtrio
behavior: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.

name: meowth
behavior: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.

name: persian
behavior: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.

name: psyduck
behavior: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.

name: golduck
behavior: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.

name: mankey
behavior: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

name: primeape
behavior: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

name: growlithe
behavior: Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any opponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.

name: arcanine
behavior: A Pokémon that has long been admired for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.

name: poliwag
behavior: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

name: poliwhirl
behavior: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.

name: poliwrath
behavior: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

name: abra
behavior: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

name: kadabra
behavior: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

name: alakazam
behavior: Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said that this Pokémon used these powers to create the spoons it holds.

name: machop
behavior: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

name: machoke
behavior: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

name: machamp
behavior: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.

name: bellsprout
behavior: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

name: weepinbell
behavior: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

name: victreebel
behavior: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

name: tentacool
behavior: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.

name: tentacruel
behavior: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.

name: geodude
behavior: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

name: graveler
behavior: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

name: golem
behavior: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.

name: ponyta
behavior: If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

name: rapidash
behavior: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.

name: slowpoke
behavior: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

name: slowbro
behavior: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.

name: magnemite
behavior: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.

name: magneton
behavior: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.

name: farfetchd
behavior: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

name: doduo
behavior: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

name: dodrio
behavior: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

name: seel
behavior: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: dewgong
behavior: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

name: grimer
behavior: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

name: muk
behavior: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

name: shellder
behavior: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

name: cloyster
behavior: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.

name: gastly
behavior: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

name: haunter
behavior: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

name: gengar
behavior: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.

name: onix
behavior: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

name: drowzee
behavior: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

name: hypno
behavior: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

name: krabby
behavior: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

name: kingler
behavior: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

name: voltorb
behavior: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.

name: electrode
behavior: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.

name: exeggcute
behavior: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

name: exeggutor
behavior: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

name: cubone
behavior: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

name: marowak
behavior: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

name: hitmonlee
behavior: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

name: hitmonchan
behavior: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

name: lickitung
behavior: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.

name: koffing
behavior: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

name: weezing
behavior: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.

name: rhyhorn
behavior: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

name: rhydon
behavior: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: chansey
behavior: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.

name: tangela
behavior: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.

name: kangaskhan
behavior: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

name: horsea
behavior: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

name: seadra
behavior: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.

name: goldeen
behavior: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

name: seaking
behavior: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

name: staryu
behavior: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

name: starmie
behavior: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

name: mr-mime
behavior: It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

name: scyther
behavior: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you’ve found is a Scyther’s territory.

name: jynx
behavior: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.

name: electabuzz
behavior: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.

name: magmar
behavior: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.

name: pinsir
behavior: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

name: tauros
behavior: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.

name: magikarp
behavior: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.

name: gyarados
behavior: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

name: lapras
behavior: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

name: ditto
behavior: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.

name: eevee
behavior: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

name: vaporeon
behavior: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.

name: jolteon
behavior: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

name: flareon
behavior: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: porygon
behavior: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

name: omanyte
behavior: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.

name: omastar
behavior: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.

name: kabuto
behavior: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.

name: kabutops
behavior: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.

name: aerodactyl
behavior: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

name: snorlax
behavior: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

name: articuno
behavior: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

name: zapdos
behavior: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.

name: moltres
behavior: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

name: dratini
behavior: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

name: dragonair
behavior: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

name: dragonite
behavior: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.

name: mewtwo
behavior: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

name: mew
behavior: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

name: chikorita
behavior: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

name: bayleef
behavior: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

name: meganium
behavior: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

name: cyndaquil
behavior: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.

name: quilava
behavior: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.

name: typhlosion
behavior: Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.

name: totodile
behavior: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

name: croconaw
behavior: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

name: feraligatr
behavior: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

name: sentret
behavior: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

name: furret
behavior: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

name: hoothoot
behavior: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.

name: noctowl
behavior: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

name: ledyba
behavior: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.

name: ledian
behavior: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.

name: spinarak
behavior: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

name: ariados
behavior: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

name: crobat
behavior: This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully. Crobat can fly through cramped caves without needing to slow down.

name: chinchou
behavior: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

name: lanturn
behavior: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

name: pichu
behavior: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.

name: cleffa
behavior: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

name: igglybuff
behavior: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.

name: togepi
behavior: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.

name: togetic
behavior: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

name: natu
behavior: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

name: xatu
behavior: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

name: mareep
behavior: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.

name: flaaffy
behavior: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

name: ampharos
behavior: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

name: bellossom
behavior: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

name: marill
behavior: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.

name: azumarill
behavior: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.

name: sudowoodo
behavior: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.

name: politoed
behavior: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.

name: hoppip
behavior: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

name: skiploom
behavior: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.

name: jumpluff
behavior: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

name: aipom
behavior: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

name: sunkern
behavior: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.

name: sunflora
behavior: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

name: yanma
behavior: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.

name: wooper
behavior: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

name: quagsire
behavior: Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head on the river bottom as it swims but seems not to care.

name: espeon
behavior: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.

name: umbreon
behavior: On the night of a full moon, or when it gets excited, the ring patterns on its body glow yellow.

name: murkrow
behavior: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow’s presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.

name: slowking
behavior: Slowking can solve any problem presented to it, but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.

name: misdreavus
behavior: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.

name: unown
behavior: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

name: wobbuffet
behavior: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

name: girafarig
behavior: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

name: pineco
behavior: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.

name: forretress
behavior: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

name: dunsparce
behavior: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.

name: gligar
behavior: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

name: steelix
behavior: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

name: snubbull
behavior: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

name: granbull
behavior: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

name: qwilfish
behavior: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.

name: scizor
behavior: Though its body is slim, Scizor has tremendous attacking power. Even Scizor’s muscles are made of metal.

name: shuckle
behavior: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

name: heracross
behavior: This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which allows it to lift things 100 times heavier than itself with no trouble at all.

name: sneasel
behavior: It has a cunning yet savage disposition. It waits for parents to leave their nests, and then it sneaks in to steal their eggs.

name: teddiursa
behavior: This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.

name: ursaring
behavior: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.

name: slugma
behavior: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

name: magcargo
behavior: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

name: swinub
behavior: If it smells something enticing, it dashes off headlong to find the source of the aroma.

name: piloswine
behavior: Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves prevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.

name: corsola
behavior: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.

name: remoraid
behavior: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine’s underside to scavenge for leftovers.

name: octillery
behavior: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

name: delibird
behavior: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.

name: mantine
behavior: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.

name: skarmory
behavior: People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

name: houndour
behavior: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.

name: houndoom
behavior: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.

name: kingdra
behavior: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been given to royalty as gifts.

name: phanpy
behavior: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.

name: donphan
behavior: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

name: porygon2
behavior: After artificial intelligence was implemented in Porygon2, the Pokémon began using a strange language that only other Porygon2 understand.

name: stantler
behavior: Stantler’s magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

name: smeargle
behavior: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

name: tyrogue
behavior: Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.

name: hitmontop
behavior: After doing a handstand to throw off the opponent’s timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.

name: smoochum
behavior: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.

name: elekid
behavior: It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people’s homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.

name: magby
behavior: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.

name: miltank
behavior: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.

name: blissey
behavior: Blissey lays mysterious eggs that are filled with happiness. It’s said that anyone who eats a Blissey egg will start acting kindly to all others.

name: raikou
behavior: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

name: entei
behavior: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

name: suicune
behavior: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

name: larvitar
behavior: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

name: pupitar
behavior: It will not stay still, even while it’s a pupa. It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.

name: tyranitar
behavior: The quakes caused when it walks make even great mountains crumble and change the surrounding terrain.

name: lugia
behavior: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

name: ho-oh
behavior: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

name: celebi
behavior: This Pokémon came from the future by crossing over time. It is thought that so long as Celebi appears, a bright and shining future awaits us.

name: treecko
behavior: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

name: grovyle
behavior: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.

name: sceptile
behavior: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

name: torchic
behavior: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

name: combusken
behavior: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.

name: blaziken
behavior: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

name: mudkip
behavior: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

name: marshtomp
behavior: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

name: swampert
behavior: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

name: poochyena
behavior: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

name: mightyena
behavior: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.

name: zigzagoon
behavior: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.

name: linoone
behavior: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.

name: wurmple
behavior: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.

name: silcoon
behavior: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.

name: beautifly
behavior: Beautifly has a long mouth like a coiled needle, which is very convenient for collecting pollen from flowers. This Pokémon rides the spring winds as it flits around gathering pollen.

name: cascoon
behavior: If it is attacked, Cascoon remains motionless however badly it may be hurt. It does so because if it were to move, its body would be weak upon evolution. This Pokémon will also not forget the pain it endured.

name: dustox
behavior: When Dustox flaps its wings, a fine dust is scattered all over. This dust is actually a powerful poison that will even make a pro wrestler sick. This Pokémon searches for food using its antennae like radar.

name: lotad
behavior: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.

name: lombre
behavior: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

name: ludicolo
behavior: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.

name: seedot
behavior: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

name: nuzleaf
behavior: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.

name: shiftry
behavior: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

name: taillow
behavior: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

name: swellow
behavior: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.

name: wingull
behavior: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.

name: pelipper
behavior: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.

name: ralts
behavior: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

name: kirlia
behavior: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.

name: gardevoir
behavior: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

name: surskit
behavior: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.

name: masquerain
behavior: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

name: shroomish
behavior: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.

name: breloom
behavior: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.

name: slakoth
behavior: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.

name: vigoroth
behavior: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.

name: slaking
behavior: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

name: nincada
behavior: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.

name: ninjask
behavior: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.

name: shedinja
behavior: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.

name: whismur
behavior: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.

name: loudred
behavior: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.

name: exploud
behavior: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.

name: makuhita
behavior: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.

name: hariyama
behavior: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

name: azurill
behavior: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.

name: nosepass
behavior: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.

name: skitty
behavior: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

name: delcatty
behavior: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.

name: sableye
behavior: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.

name: mawile
behavior: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

name: aron
behavior: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron’s shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.

name: lairon
behavior: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.

name: aggron
behavior: Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He was trying to channel the Pokémon’s strength.

name: meditite
behavior: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

name: medicham
behavior: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

name: electrike
behavior: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.

name: manectric
behavior: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.

name: plusle
behavior: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.

name: minun
behavior: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

name: volbeat
behavior: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

name: illumise
behavior: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.

name: roselia
behavior: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.

name: gulpin
behavior: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

name: swalot
behavior: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.

name: carvanha
behavior: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

name: sharpedo
behavior: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.

name: wailmer
behavior: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.

name: wailord
behavior: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

name: numel
behavior: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.

name: camerupt
behavior: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

name: torkoal
behavior: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

name: spoink
behavior: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.

name: grumpig
behavior: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.

name: spinda
behavior: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!

name: trapinch
behavior: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

name: vibrava
behavior: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.

name: flygon
behavior: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.

name: cacnea
behavior: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.

name: cacturne
behavior: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

name: swablu
behavior: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.

name: altaria
behavior: This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it’s provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill cries before attacking them without mercy.

name: zangoose
behavior: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

name: seviper
behavior: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.

name: lunatone
behavior: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

name: solrock
behavior: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

name: barboach
behavior: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.

name: whiscash
behavior: It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes near it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.

name: corphish
behavior: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.

name: crawdaunt
behavior: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.

name: baltoy
behavior: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

name: claydol
behavior: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

name: lileep
behavior: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.

name: cradily
behavior: Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles, it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.

name: anorith
behavior: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.

name: armaldo
behavior: Though it lives on land, it’s also a good swimmer. It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its sharp claws to take down its quarry.

name: feebas
behavior: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

name: milotic
behavior: It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.

name: castform
behavior: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!

name: kecleon
behavior: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.

name: shuppet
behavior: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”

name: banette
behavior: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.

name: duskull
behavior: Making itself invisible, it silently sneaks up to prey. It has the ability to slip through thick walls.

name: dusclops
behavior: It seeks drifting will-o’-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.

name: tropius
behavior: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.

name: chimecho
behavior: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.

name: absol
behavior: Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.

name: wynaut
behavior: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

name: snorunt
behavior: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as −150 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: glalie
behavior: It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere. It uses this power to freeze its foes.

name: spheal
behavior: As it drifts among the waves, Spheal probes the sea. As soon as it spots prey, it informs the Walrein in its herd.

name: sealeo
behavior: This Pokémon has a habit of spinning round things on its nose, whether those things are Poké Balls or Spheal.

name: walrein
behavior: Walrein’s tusks keep growing throughout its life. Tusks broken in battle will grow back to their usual impressive size in a year.

name: clamperl
behavior: Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder’s pearls.

name: huntail
behavior: Deep seas are their habitat. According to tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore, something unfortunate will happen.

name: gorebyss
behavior: It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it becomes food for other Pokémon.

name: relicanth
behavior: This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in 100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.

name: luvdisc
behavior: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.

name: bagon
behavior: Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form groups with others of its kind. It also has a head hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.

name: shelgon
behavior: Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once all its energy stores are used up.

name: salamence
behavior: While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.

name: beldum
behavior: The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic forces flow through Beldum’s body.

name: metang
behavior: Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.

name: metagross
behavior: Metagross is the result of the fusion of two Metang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents through use of its supercomputer-level brain.

name: regirock
behavior: Cutting-edge technology was used to study the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.

name: regice
behavior: This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in the ice age.

name: registeel
behavior: It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet’s mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.

name: latias
behavior: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
